Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Developers intentionally avoided MHA-zoned areas – despite their upzoning– opting instead to build on nearby blocks without affordability requirements.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Researchers Jacob Krimmel and Betty X. Wang published a new study confirming the complaints of MHA's critics.

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Many tenants continue living in units without paying rent and rack up tens of thousands of dollars in debts, a massive financial hole that is difficult to escape from.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Landlords are blaming the situation on a mix of higher operating costs and the housing court delays caused by D.C.'s pandemic-era eviction policies.

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: A detailed Los Angeles Times investigation published in November 2023 reported a number of issues at AHF-owned properties...

More than 80% of housing properties that have received D.C. funding aren't bringing in enough rental income to pay their mortgages and maintenance costs, according to the District's Department of Housing and Community Development.
Document Sources.Name of Source: District's Department of Housing and Community Development

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Delinquencies have risen dramatically, the report [by Apartment and Office Building Association] concludes, because of D.C.'s pandemic-era policies...

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: HUD told me in a statement that AHF 'is part of a team that applied for these awards. The team is not only eligible, but the best qualified applicant.'
Named Organization Sources.Name of Source: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD)
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Official statement from HUD regarding the grant to AHF
Recipient of a $10 million 'tenant empowerment' grant, also mentioned for managing residential properties with reported issues
